data.title: Daytona Joins the Cloud Native Computing Foundation
data.meta_description: Daytona Joins the Cloud Native Computing Foundation, Leveraging Industry-Leading Technologies for Developer Empowerment
data.text:
Daytona, the developer-first company dedicated to optimizing software development workflows, has officially joined the prestigious Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF). This membership signifies Daytona's commitment to providing top-tier tools and environments that facilitate seamless and efficient development processes.

The CNCF is an open-source software foundation dedicated to making cloud-native computing ubiquitous. It hosts and nurtures many of the industry's most influential open-source projects, including Kubernetes, Prometheus, and Envoy, among others. Daytona's membership in the Cloud Native Computing Foundation was recently announced alongside 44 other new members joining the Foundation.

By joining the CNCF, Daytona gains a platform to collaborate with industry leaders, contribute to key cloud-native projects, and influence the development of cutting-edge technologies that power its products.

Daytona, built by developers for developers, is specifically designed to improve the management of development environments, thereby fostering innovation and efficiency in the development craft.

Goran DraganiÄ, Chief Architect at Daytona

Embracing Cloud-Native Ecosystems for Collective Growth

"Being a member of the CNCF is a win-win for us," said Zoran Zorica, Senior Infrastructure Engineer at Daytona. At the core of Daytona's offerings is its enterprise development environment solution, built on cloud-native principles and powered by technologies such as Kubernetes, Keycloak, Prometheus, containerd, cri-o, and Helm.

By actively engaging with the CNCF community, Daytona can influence the evolution of these critical projects and deliver robust, scalable solutions that meet the ever-evolving needs of its customers.

Our development environment tool actively contributes to the vibrant cloud-native ecosystem, and in turn, we gain invaluable insights and collaboration opportunities through CNCF membership. We leverage industry-leading technologies under the CNCF umbrella, like Kubernetes, which is the foundation of our enterprise product. The CNCF's commitment to fostering open-source innovation perfectly aligns with our values.

Zoran Zorica, Senior Infrastructure Engineer at Daytona

"We are now proud members of the Cloud Native Computing Foundation, showcasing our commitment to empowering developers and shaping the future of cloud-native technologies alongside industry leaders," said Goran DraganiÄ, Chief Architect at Daytona.

Industry Recognition and Future Aspirations

As a CNCF member, Daytona joins a vibrant community of organizations dedicated to advancing cloud-native computing. The company will actively participate in CNCF events, contribute to open source projects, and collaborate with industry peers to drive innovation and best practices in the cloud-native ecosystem.

Daytona envisions a world where developers can fully immerse themselves in their craft, liberated from mundane tasks and operational friction, supported by a cloud-native infrastructure that is as resilient as it is dynamic.

About Daytona

Daytona provides enterprise development environment management solutions, empowering organizations to streamline and optimize their software development processes. Built on cloud-native principles, Daytona's solutions leverage cutting-edge technologies to deliver scalable, efficient, and secure development environments that accelerate innovation and time-to-market.

For more information on Daytona's latest development solutions, visit Daytona's Github profile and watch our open-source Daytona repository.

Join Daytona at KubeCon
